sources.title: Larceny (1948)
sources.description: John Payne is the no-good lowdown rat who tries to capitalize on postwar patriotism and grief. He finagles a war widow into giving up her savings for a nonexistent memorial. When Payne falls in love with the widow he has pangs of conscience, but he reckons without his con-artist boss, who tends to bolster his arguments with muscle and bullets. Watch on RetroFlix.org: https://retroflix.org/larceny-1948/

sources.title: Larceny (1948) John Payne, Joan Caulfield, Dan Duryea, Shelley Winters - Film Noir
sources.description: Larceny is a 1948 American film noir crime film directed by George Sherman starring John Payne, Joan Caulfield, Dan Duryea and Shelley Winters. Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larceny_(1948_film) Suggested Film Noirs: http://bit.ly/2tLevkl The Internet Archive is an excellent choice for entire full length Netflix & YouTube style uploads of drama, mystery, thriller & crime noir movies from the UK & USA for free. Download complete online British & American classic black & white films from the 1940s & 1950s.

metadata.Plot: A con man sets out to swindle a widow out of the money she's received to build a memorial to her war hero husband, but winds up falling in love with her instead.
metadata.Writer: Herb Margolis, Lou Morheim, William Bowers
metadata.Actors: John Payne, Joan Caulfield, Dan Duryea
